channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.description: The latest stories from the Europe section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Turkey 'shot down plane for IS oil'
item.description: Russia says Turkey shot down one of its planes near the border with Syria to protect its oil trade with Islamic State - a trade Turkey has always denied.

item.title: Hamburg says 'No' to 2024 Olympics
item.description: Residents of the German city of Hamburg vote against hosting the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games in a referendum.

item.title: Giant of Soviet cinema Ryazanov dies
item.description: Eldar Ryazanov, whose comedy films gently satirised aspects of life in the Soviet Union, dies aged 88.

item.title: Greek PM in Turkey Twitter outburst
item.description: Greek PM Alexis Tsipras attacks his Turkish counterpart on Twitter following the downing of a Russian plane, prompting an admonishing reply.

item.title: Neymar, Ronaldo & Messi up for award
item.description: Neymar, Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi are on the shortlist for the Ballon d'Or - the world footballer of the year award.

item.title: Crimea blackout 'sabotage by Ukraine'
item.description: Russian PM Dmitry Medvedev accuses Ukraine of "sabotage" after damage to key electricity pylons deprived Crimea of power.

item.title: High-level climate talks open in Paris
item.description: Leaders from 150 nations open a key UN conference in Paris aimed at reaching a deal on curbing carbon emissions to tackle global warning.

item.title: Turkey rounds up hundreds of migrants
item.description: Hours after deal with EU about migrants, Turkish authorities round up some 1,300 migrants who were allegedly bound for Greece, state news reports.

item.title: Labour MPs to get free vote on Syria
item.description: Jeremy Corbyn grants Labour MPs a free vote on UK air strikes in Syria, before a Commons debate and vote is announced for Wednesday.

item.title: NI abortion law 'breaches human rights'
item.description: The High Court in Belfast rules abortion legislation in Northern Ireland is in breach of human rights laws.

item.title: Artistic director Luc Bondy dies at 67
item.description: Luc Bondy, the international Swiss director of opera, theatre and film, dies at the age of 67.

item.title: Israel suspends EU role in peace talks
item.description: Israel suspends diplomatic contact with EU officials involved in the Middle East peace process, after a row over EU moves to label West Bank settlement goods.

item.title: Brussels security delays St Nicholas
item.description: St Nicholas's traditional Christmas welcome by schoolchildren in Brussels is pushed back by the raised security threat level.

item.title: Deserter hid in woods for 11 years
item.description: Authorities catch up with soldier previously declared dead.

item.title: Lufthansa agrees pay deal with staff
item.description: German airline Lufthansa strikes pay deal with 30,000 ground staff as it looks to avoid further strikes.

item.title: Dutch to appeal Starbucks tax ruling
item.description: The Dutch finance ministry says it will fight a ruling ordering it to recover as much as €30m (£21.2m) in tax from Starbucks.

item.title: VIDEO: European Parliament
item.description: MEPs debate proposals to allow the early release of EU investment funds to Greece.

item.title: VIDEO: Peace-keeping meetings in 'no-man's land'
item.description: Rayhan Demytrie reports from one of the monthly meetings aimed at resolving tensions between Georgia and Russia over South Ossetia, one of Georgia's two breakaway regions.

item.title: VIDEO: Caught on camera: Battle where lawyer is killed
item.description: A leading pro-Kurdish lawyer has been shot dead in south-eastern Turkey during a gun battle between police and unidentified gunmen.

item.title: VIDEO: Do Syrians want to leave Turkey?
item.description: The BBC's Mark Lowen finds out if some Syrians wish to stay in Turkey or travel to Europe.

item.title: VIDEO: Clashes as Macedonia erects border fence
item.description: Macedonia erects a fence on its border with Greece to limit the flow of migrants to the country.

item.title: VIDEO: Drug smuggling in fake ambulances
item.description: A Dutch man has been found guilty over a £1.6bn drugs smuggling operation where he posed as a handyman on a fake ambulance.

item.title: VIDEO: 'Their laughter, we'll never hear again'
item.description: At a memorial service in Paris, President Francois Hollande pays tribute to the victims of the gun and bomb attacks in the city two weeks ago.

item.title: VIDEO: Salah Abdeslam 'phoned people for lift'
item.description: A friend of one of the main suspects still being hunted by police after the Paris attacks has said Salah Abdeslam phoned people in Brussels following the attacks and asked them to drive to get him.

item.title: VIDEO: Paris after attacks: 'I'm pessimistic'
item.description: Two weeks on from the Paris terror attacks, in which 130 people lost their lives, some Parisians share their thoughts and feelings.

item.title: Links to Lenin: The past Swiss villagers tried to forget
item.description: The past that some Swiss villagers tried to forget

item.title: VIDEO: Switzerland’s vanishing natural wonder
item.description: Drone footage shows retreat of Switzerland's Rhone Glacier

item.title: A legacy of fry-ups and red postboxes
item.description: A country attached to fry-ups and red post boxes

item.title: Why Cyprus backs Cameron's push for UK air strikes in Syria
item.description: Why Cyprus backs UK airstrikes against Islamic State

item.title: Ukraine's police say 'goodbye' to Russian social networks
item.description: Ukraine's police warned off the Russian internet
